Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2012 06:38PM Pawprint wrote: I know you are scared. This is the right place to talk about that. There will be wonderful people here on this forum to talk with and learn from. I hope it's not cancer. But if it is you can try and call American Cancer Society and tell them you don't have insurance and need financial help with medical tests. I wish you the best. Keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Scared, trying not to worry mar994 pupmom

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2012 07:11AM Pawprint wrote: Hi jabal, I don't understand why the radiologist told you that you have cancer. Usually you hear this information from your doctor, after your doctor has all the information from the biopsy. I know you are scared. Really the not knowing and waiting is the hardest part. Once you know for sure and have a treatment plan the fear lessens. I truly hope it's not cancer, but if it is you will find lots of excellent information here at breastcancer.org, try not to research too much. I know that's hard. Sending a hug to you. Keep us posted when you talk to your doctor next Tuesday and you get biopsy results.

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2012 04:53PM Pawprint wrote: Wishing all of you August Girls the very best....may you all have rapid recoveries with very limited pain. Sending you hugs. You are all amazing and courageous. Take it slow, let others help you, and continue to support each other in this forum. I was in the August 2010 group and am now 2 years past double mastectomy w/implant reconstruction and taking Arimidex. Sending healing wishes to you all.

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2010 11:36AM Pawprint wrote: hi leelee, yes i just had that surgery done on August 13. I have been posting in the Aug 2010 mastectomy forum. I have tissue expanders in and they filled them half way during the surgery. The incisions were around my nipples and I am numb there. I think you will be pleased with your decision. I am heading out the door to go back to work, day one since surgery. Check out my posts and the other girls in the 2010 August Mastectomy group.Â  Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: Nipple sparing mastectomy leelee32 Pawprint

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2010 01:16PM Pawprint wrote: Good luck to you Basia. I had a few biopsies and waiting for the results is the hardest part. My insurance also initially turned down my MRI but after a few weeks and my doctor calling them they finally agreed to it. So try not to get ahead of yourself and worry too much and diagnose. When you get all the tests done the doctors will have a clearer picture and treatment plan. Sending hugs your way.
